info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 16 at 2:16AM PST until December 16 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph in exposed areas. * WHERE...Southern Oregon Cascades and Siskiyous including Highway 62 near Union Creek and Diamond Lake and Highway 138 near Diamond Lake. * WHEN...Until 9 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or https://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions.
